Class PVTRegressionFunction

java.lang.Object
neqsim.statistics.parameterfitting.BaseFunction
neqsim.statistics.parameterfitting.nonlinearparameterfitting.LevenbergMarquardtFunction
neqsim.pvtsimulation.regression.PVTRegressionFunction
All Implemented Interfaces:
Cloneable, FunctionInterface
public class PVTRegressionFunction extends LevenbergMarquardtFunction
Objective function for PVT regression using Levenberg-Marquardt optimization.

This function computes the calculated value for a given experimental data point using the current parameter values. The Levenberg-Marquardt algorithm minimizes the sum of squared residuals between calculated and experimental values.

Version:
1.0
Author:
ESOL

    • calcValue

      public double calcValue(double[] dependentValues)
      Calculate the value for a given experimental data point. The dependentValues array contains:
      • [0] = pressure (bar)
      • [1] = temperature (K)
      • [2] = experiment type ordinal
      • [3] = property index (0=primary, 1=secondary, etc.)
      • [4] = additional info (e.g., reservoir temperature for separator tests)
      Specified by:
      calcValue in interface FunctionInterface
      Overrides:
      calcValue in class LevenbergMarquardtFunction
      Parameters:
      dependentValues - array of dependent values for this data point
      Returns:
      calculated value
